data.title: Incorrect ligature rendering
data.body: Atom seems to have trouble rendering some ligatures. Apparently it's to do with the way the syntax highlighter handles things. Here's an example of what it looks like in Atom: And here's what it looks like in the terminal with the same font enabled: This problem seems to affect things that involve the `>` character, such as `=>`, `->`, `|>`, and `$>`; which all render incorrectly most of the time. The font I'm using to test this, is [_Fira Code_](https://github.com/tonsky/FiraCode).

data.title: Locking up when... interacting with XTerm/pty.js?
data.body:
### Description

Atom locks up when resizing the panel.. or interacting with XTerm. Unsure how to debug as it's not obvious what's locked up.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install script-runner package
2. Go to ~/.atom/package/script-runner/examples
3. Execute `htop.sh` example.
4. In the panel that pops up, interact with htop rapidly, e.g. clicking on rows with the mouse, pressing up/down on the keyboard and resizing then panel rapidly.

Eventually Atom will completely lock up with no obvious error.

### Versions

% atom --version
Atom    : 1.12.7
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

% uname -a
Linux koyoko.local 4.8.12-3-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Dec 8 16:10:23 CET 2016 x86_64 GNU/Linux

data.title: Multiple fixes for RPM and in docs RPM distros.
data.body:
* Correct requires for libXss across Fedora/RedHat (and derivatives) and SUSE.
* Split instructions for Fedora and RHEL etc. i.e. yum and dnf.
* Never use --assumeyes or -y installing packages. atom 1.12.7 shows if
  this had been done by end users it would have caused them great issue.
* Fedora 22 is End Of Life (EOL), so no instructions needed.

data.title: Dynamic text substitution for pretty symbols?
data.body:
Hi, a question: can Atom "replace" the presentation (display) of certain text patterns while keeping the underlying char sequences intact?

To be clear, I'm wondering if it would be possible for a package to imitate Spacemacs Clojure layer's fancify-symbols [feature](https://github.com/syl20bnr/spacemacs/blob/c788da709bb1c74344f5ab1b6f18cfdf6b930df8/layers/%2Blang/clojure/funcs.el#L12). What it does is replace instances of the `fn`, `partial`, `comp`, `#()`, `#{}` keywords and literals with the symbols `λ`, `Ƥ`, `∘`, `ƒ`, `∈`, respectively. The substitutions are done _as you type_.

To illustrate:
```clojure
;; Insertion
(fn_
(λ _
(λ [] (partial_
(λ [] (Ƥ _
(λ [] (Ƥ (comp_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ _
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ #_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(inc %) ƒ(dec %))) ; #_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(inc %) ƒ(dec %))) ; ∈{_

;; Deletion

(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(inc %) ƒ(dec %))) ; ∈{_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(inc %) ƒ(dec %))) ; ∈_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(inc %) ƒ(dec %))) ; ∈_{
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(inc %) ƒ(dec %))) ; _{

(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ(_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ_
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ ƒ_(
(λ [] (Ƥ (∘ _(

(λ [] (Ƥ (∘_
(λ [] (Ƥ (com_
(λ [] (Ƥ_
(λ [] (partia_
(λ_
(f_
```

Cheers, and thanks for Atom. :)

data.body:

### Description

When I start Atom the editor freezes. I have tried re-installing but the bug persists.
### Steps to Reproduce

1. [First Step]
Just open Atom and it freezes and then a window pops up saying it is not responding.
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

### Versions


You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Fix issue where editor fails to regain focus
data.body:
When changing the workspace's pane configuration, the `PaneContainer` needs to sometimes remove intermediate `PaneAxis` objects from the DOM. When it does this, it [tries to restore focus](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/89e3891d826e1c2eceb2d948203c668a4f65e0f3/src/pane-container-element.coffee#L17) to the previously-focused node.

This stopped working for text editors when we [removed the shadow DOM](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12903) because when a text editor is focused, it transfers focus to its hidden input element. This hidden input element was destroyed and re-created every time the editor was detached and re-attached.

This PR solves that problem by making the `TextEditorElement` keep a long-lived reference to a hidden input element, and re-using that same hidden input element every time it is attached to the DOM.

🍐 'd with @damieng

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13206

data.title: Fix toggle-line-comments bug in LanguageMode
data.body:
This will fix a bug when executing `editor:toggle-line-comments` in a file with a grammar without comments (or without a `commentStartString`), for example plain text.

Before this update i got this exception:
```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'split' of undefined
    at Function.module.exports.Range.fromText (/usr/lib/atom/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/range.js:47:19)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.setTextInRange (/usr/lib/atom/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:608:24)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.insert (/usr/lib/atom/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:627:19)
    at LanguageMode.module.exports.LanguageMode.toggleLineCommentsForBufferRows (/usr/lib/atom/src/language-mode.js:98:22)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.toggleLineCommentsForBufferRows (/usr/lib/atom/src/text-editor.js:3570:32)
    at Selection.module.exports.Selection.toggleLineComments (/usr/lib/atom/src/selection.js:684:67)
    at /usr/lib/atom/src/text-editor.js:1405:26
    at /usr/lib/atom/src/text-editor.js:1107:28
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.transact (/usr/lib/atom/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:866:18)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.transact (/usr/lib/atom/src/text-editor.js:1524:26)
```

data.title: Check now button downloads updates instead of just checking for them
data.body:
The `Check now` button in the `About` window starts to download an available update right away instead of just checking for it and letting the user know if an update is available or not.

While I often like to check if an update is available, I do not always want to download it right away (maybe it's just a minor version, maybe I'm on a slow/unreliable network).

So I think the `Check now` button should do what it claims to do: check if an update is available and if ask the user if he wants to download it or not. This is how it works in most other software packages.

data.title: File system error for Atom on Mac Sierra OS
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [ I don't think this is applicable] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [ Yes] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [ Yes] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [ Yes ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [ I think so] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [Yes ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description

Description:
It appears that Atom can't find a file and continues searching for it. I noticed this in var/log/system.log of Mac running Sierra v10.12.1

### Steps to Reproduce
Not sure

Dec  7 13:59:11 Jamess-MBP com.apple.xpc.launchd[1] (com.github.atom.ShipIt[49509]): Service exited with abnormal code: 1
Dec  7 13:59:11 Jamess-MBP com.apple.xpc.launchd[1] (com.github.atom.ShipIt): Service only ran for 0 seconds. Pushing respawn out by 2 seconds.
Dec  7 13:59:13 Jamess-MBP ShipIt[49510]: Installation error: Error Domain=SQRLShipItRequestErrorDomain Code=2 "Could not read update request" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Could not read update request, NSUnderlyingError=0x7f9eb4d013c0 {Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “ShipItState.plist” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo={NSFilePath=/var/root/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist, NSUnderlyingError=0x7f9eb4d00f30 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}}}




**Expected behavior:**Would not expect to see file system error.

**Actual behavior:** file system error continually appearing

### Versions
Latest Atom - I think I have updated several times over about ten days.
OS version Sierra 10.12.1

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: editor doesn't update file paths after renaming folder in Tree View.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
Version 1.12.16
### Description

editor doesn't update file paths after renaming folder in Tree View.

If I have such structure:
```
foo/
     index.js
```
and I rename `foo` folder to `bar` in Tree View, file in editor still has `foo/index.js` path.

Sometimes this makes confusion, because I have later two copies of files (changed `bar/index.js` and `foo/index.js` which is only in memory, not on disk, because it was moved). 

So, here I change:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3883359/20952885/d5af4570-bc2f-11e6-89f7-ffe0842c970c.png)

And there is still old directory on the right side:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3883359/20952927/2d1679b4-bc30-11e6-9152-d872ab1d5f94.png)
Notice that on the right is `gui/AppTopBar` even if it was renamed to `view/AppTopBar`
this is confusing, because this file is no longer stored on disk, so additionaly when I click [x] there is a message `AppTopBar.js' has changes, do you want to save them?`

data.title: Atom crashes in Full screen mode( Cannot exit)
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description

Atom would out of full screen mode and "Keep Waiting" dialog appears

### Steps to Reproduce

1. start atom from command line or .exe
2. enter full screen mode
3. close/ reopen and try exiting fullscreen mode via shortcut or menu context

**Expected behavior:**

Atom UI should exit full screen mode

**Actual behavior:** 

Atom UI refuses to exit full screen mode

### Versions

Windows:  8
Atom    : 1.12.6
Electron: 1.3.9
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

data.title: Atom does not respect UTF-16 LE w/ BOM file
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* The problem can be reproduced in safe mode
* Running Atom 1.12.6, the latest version

### Description

When I open a UTF-16 LE with BOM file in Atom, Atom thinks it is UTF8 file and additional lines are added.  There are also other problem linked to the misinterpretation UTF16 vs UTF8 by Atom.

I've seen some similar discussions on this, but they are talking about general case UTF8/16/32.  So I think a specific bug issue might be easier to manage.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a UTF-16 LE with BOM file in Atom.  Such file can be generated with the following command in elevated DOS window:
secedit /export /cfg C:\temp\new.cfg

2. Observe the bottom right corner in Atom and it's written UTF-8

**Expected behavior:** Since BOM is inside the file, Atom should recognize it as UTF-16 LE

**Actual behavior:** Wrongly recognize the file as UTF-8

### Versions
1.12.6

data.title: Flush DOM before displaying context menu [2]
data.body:
Electron has an issue where displaying the context menu pauses the rendering loop. https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/1854

One unfortunate side effect is that when you right click on an element, the dom mutations to highlight the element have not been flushed yet which makes for a very bad user experience https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2991

In order to solve this issue, we would like to flush the mutations and only then display the menu. Unfortunately, electron doesn't have APIs for that.

Things I have tried:
1) Electron has `browserWindow.webContents.invalidate()` and `.on('paint' -> ...)` but it only works with offscreen rendering which     atom doesn't use.
2) `.capturePage(-> ...)` takes a screenshot of the page and I hoped it     would do a flush first but it inconsistently displays the highlight     so it won't work.
3) `Using setTimeout((-> ...), 16)` works many times but not always
4) `requestAnimationFrame(-> ...)` should be what we want but unfortunately     it doesn't always show the highlights :(

What I found worked was to nest three `requestAnimationFrame`, it works all the time even when my machine is busy. This is not a 100% solution but I think that it's okay to assume that if the highlight hasn't been updated in three frames then you should probably try and optimize your code. 3 frames is 50ms and that delay isn't noticeable.

Note: the proper way to solve this that was mentioned in the issue is to open the menu from the main process but this is already what atom does and it's still an issue.

Before:
![](http://g.recordit.co/DruDVLJoN9.gif)

After:
![](http://g.recordit.co/PxBnwNt5yy.gif)

Released under CC0

data.title: Revert "Flush DOM before displaying context menu"
data.body:
Reverts atom/atom#13266 as it doesn't address #2991.

/cc: @vjeux

data.title: Large Json on file.json
data.body:
### Description

I was working with large jsons (more than 50000 characteres), if you push a json into a single line file with .json extension, the pointer at the end of line is delayed.

Gif to show problem
http://gph.is/2h2fu7m

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Save file with json extension
2. Paste Large Json
3. Go to the end of line

**Expected behavior:** The current pointer position needs to be synchronized with the real position of it.

**Actual behavior:** When you try to delete some character, the action take place elsewhere.

### Versions
iOS 10.10.5 Yosemite
Atom version 1.12.6

data.title: file content gone
data.body: a project file content i worked on every detail is saved after electricity came back is gone. is there any solution to get contents back.
